Reviews.Title: “Maya Stephan”
Reviews.Author: mayastephan
Reviews.Content: Pleasant experience.Amazing rooms ,very spacious with private hamam .Heated floor spacious bed .Good location,plenty of bars and cafes.Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Service”
Reviews.Author: Fauster
Reviews.Content: It is always a nice touch when you call the front desk, housekeeping or room service and they answer the phone greeting you by name. A nice touch but no mystery - it is just caller ID on the phone system. But how does this hotel pull off the trick of every - and I mean every - staff person greeting you by name whenever they encounter you? Even the first time with no prior identification possible. I don't really want to know. Some things are best left a mystery but this does speak volumes about the attention to personalized service this hotel focuses on. Then there is the hotel itself. Perfectly located in the heart of the happening part of Istanbul. The rooms are ultra modern luxurious without being ostentatious. Definitely would return and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pushed all the right buttons”
Reviews.Author: Paul J
Reviews.Content: I am not given to effusive praise, but the Park Hyatt in Istanbul was an exceptionally pleasant experience. The hotel offers understated elegance, attentive service, and many subtle but very pleasant amenities. These range from the motorized blackout curtains, to the steam shower, in-room Nespresso machine, and very fast internet. The food in the hotel restaurants was very high quality. In addition, the neighborhood offered high-end shops and pleasant eating and drinking establishments. I am already looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Shoppers !”
Reviews.Author: EmaJayKay
Reviews.Content: Expected of a Park Hyatt and didn't disappoint. Extremely friendly staff all with excellent english and very very helpful, especially the front desk and concierge(s). Room was modern, efficient and very comfortable, black-out-windows and a great bed ensured a good nights sleep. The lobby bar (if you could call it that) was dead as a doornail and over the 4 day stay I didn't see anyone at all drinking in it - its a wine bar - but in reality is really just a side show in the lobby and didn't even have a barman in attendance so that may well have something to do with it...hardly inviting ! But that aside, the rest of the stay was great, and the location - if you don't need to be on the Bosphorous and with Boshporous views (and for that you pay dearly) - is great for shoppers and cafe life and a cool crowd around the hotel area. Plenty of bars in the street and streetside cafes aplenty .. one we liked a lot was "Cento Cento" just 50m from the hotel in the main nice shopping street, great wines, busy busy busy and good pizza - along with great viewing and people watching ! Good value upmarket comfortable luxury hotel in a great spot for shopping and coffee ! Easily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: miamibeacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in February, 2012. The room and common areas were fantastic. The staff was very good on recommending restaurants including the one across the street, which I highly recommend for fresh Turkish food. Wife and I had a great massage at the spa. All in all, a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: jimmyprosper
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel on valentine's day. Very pleasantly surprised (though I somewhat expected it) but the surprise was beyond even my expectations. Great rooms, great shower, great tub, great steam. Wonderful heated floor in the bathroom. Cannot figure out the heated floor setting in the room. If only I got a nice view, it will complete the surprise, but no complain. Check in staff was rather slow and not as swift as I expect a $300/night hotel should behave. Overall was great and would come back again definitely. Bfast was simple but classy, however service during bfast was slow and inattentive (very unfortunately)

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Hotel, Top Notch Staff”
Reviews.Author: ThirteenRight
Reviews.Content: This hotel is akin to driving a brand new Jaguar when everyone else seems to have a BMW or a car like that. Same price range, but a Jaguar is just different - it says something about you. Park Hyatts are similar in that way, especially this hotel. It's not flashy luxury (Rolls Royce) or ubiquitous luxury (BMW, Mercedes) - it is the type of luxury that Park Hyatt does best - subtle, sexy, smart, modern, understated, classic. Park Hyatt Istanbul is no exception to that. Staff is top notch. Location couldn't be better - it's tucked away on a quiet street that is steps to the hustle and bustle. The rooms are gorgeous - they *start* at 430 sq. ft.! Overall, this is a magnificent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good option.”
Reviews.Author: rgpepe
Reviews.Content: If you look for a good place near to the Downtown Istambul, this is a good option. Rooms are very good size, including modern system of lighting and communication. Price is a bit high. The breakfast is good. The only problem I found is that there is not a good bar. Even there is bar service, it is not a real bar to spend time drinking with friends. Staff is very friendly and service in general is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment Throughout”
Reviews.Author: jmleon72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Hyatt Istanbul for 5 nights and we were amzed by the hospitality and property. The hotel is located in a trendy neighborhood which was safe and had many shopping and eating options. However, you needed a taxi to get to any of the major tourist sites. The lobby and common areas are large and well laid out--there are nice wooded terraces in the lobby that made nice informal places for sitting and people watching. Our room had old world charm, but was updated with all modern amenities. Our favorite part of our room was the tub and shower area with our own personal steam room. What really impressed us was the service. The staff went over and above the call of duty to make sure we had great dinner, drink and shopping options. The guest relations manager and concierge took a personal genuine interest in how our experiences went each morning. They saw to it that each day our complimentary Diamond breakfast became more generous and lavish--they would allow us to sample more items at each breakfast. The team here really spoiled us and we will not forget the excellent treatment and hospitality. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “WOW- King Spa Room”
Reviews.Author: AllenandMaureen
Reviews.Content: King Spa room was amazing! Staff was superb. The level of hospitality was. Food and wine in the restaurant was great. We really enjoyed the location. Lots of good restaurants and fun shopping in easy walking distance. January in Istanbul at the Park Hyatt. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The best Hyatt I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: jt93traveller
Reviews.Content: My family's stay at the Park Hyatt Macka Palas from 18th to 22nd December 2011 remains in my mind just like a dream. Arriving at 6am in the morning after a very long flight from Australia, the hotel staff and reception were incredibly warm and accommodating, having our room ready (room 707) and arranging for us to have buffet breakfast on the day of our arrival instead of the day of our departure, since our departing flight required us to leave early in the morning for Athens. All the staff is very attentive but never is anyone on top of you. The hotel exudes a quiet charm and elegance - it is as if it is a sanctuary amidst the hussle and bustle of Istanbul. ROOMS We booked the most basic twin room for 3 ppl and we were treated like KIngs and Queens. The hotel itself is very new (only 3 yrs old) and the rooms are very spacious. I had the best roll-away bed out of my whole EU trip here, whilst my parents' bed was incredily comfortable and very large - they couldn't touch each other! The view is of Galata Tower and the street the hotel faces (Bronz Sokak or Nisantasi, both views are stunning). The nespresso machien was a bonus and so easy, whilst the bathroom is very well designed and has heated tiling, separate wash basin area, separate toilet and separate bath and shower. In fact, the shower had a hammam inside - it was definitely the best shower I have ever experienced in my whole life and you truly feel clean, destressed and relaxed after having a hammam shower. Of course, you don't have to have the hammam on if you wish to have a shower! BREAKFAST I prefer a smaller range at buffet breakfasts with quality and fresh produce and an a la carte menu to choose hot food - and this is exactly what the Park Hyatt serves and I believe they've hit the jackpot here! Their cheese pie and koulouria (round bread) was to die for and their entire delicatessen section was updated daily and beautiful. The waiters were very professional, cooking us a range of hot food every day from Eggs Florentine to Omelettes, French Toast and Eggs with Chorizo sausage, etc. Their cappuccinos are amazing and so are the hot chocolates. THE PRIME RESTAURANT We celebrated our last night after an exhilirating and dream-like trip in Istanbul at the hotel's restaurant, The Prime. It had been my birthday and the hotel was kind enough to allow my father to bring a very special and expensive bottle of Sth African wine we had been given by a special American family friend of ours. I was glad to see that all the staff at the Park Hyatt, especially at the Prime, espoused a level of finesse we lack greatly in Australia and in the US. The steaks and seafood are cooked in front of you - it is an open air kitchen - and I can tell you it was good value! We were looked after very well and we were even surprised by a special Birthday Cake the hotel had arranged for me, with all the staff and my family singing "happy birthday" - a brilliant touch. LOCATION Istanbul is too large of a city to walk everywhere. We did LOTS of walking in Istanbul adn wore the soles out of our shoes, but I can assure you there is no one place where all the tourist & historic sites are! The hotel is perfectly situated in a very safe, busy and upmarket area called Nisantasi - we think it is the best area to stay in because you have everything at your doorstep. I have never seen designer stores as plentiful in number and as busy in nature as the ones here near the hotel, in Istanbul! Streets are so clean and picture perfect, everyone will love them, and designer shopping is cheap compared to what we pay in EU and especially compared to Australia! An added bonus is that taxis are quite cheap in Istanbul and plentiful in number. Many thanks to the hotel for the concierge's TOP recommendations for dinner on 3 nights in a row - remember to try out the restaurant right opposite the hotel for a true Turkish cuisine experience with a classy twist. Not expensive at all! We hope to come back to Istanbul as soon as possible and we are truly indebted to the hotel for making our holiday so magical and for helping us forge such an affinity with the beautiful city of cultural, historical and religious wealth that is Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: BeliNY
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful hotel. The rooms are amazing. It's located a bit far from main tourist attractions for visiting during the day (taxis in Istanbul are very reasonable) but nice neighborhood, close to nice restaurants/bars to go to at night. Totally worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Return for the 2nd time - Love It”
Reviews.Author: anakanakkapal
Reviews.Content: Staff was professional & friendly, hotel was quite - small but big enough. my room 409 - was with shower with steam room, separate bathtub, separate toilet and huge bed.. Etc the reason why i come back. If not becoz of the traffic i will definitely enjoy istanbul much more

Reviews.Title: “near perfect - tops in the entire Hyatt Chain”
Reviews.Author: maddbob
Reviews.Content: I just finished a wonderful stay at the Park Hyatt Istanbul. I think I have a new favorite Hyatt and really do this property is one of the top two or three in the entire Hyatt chain. Everything from the accommodations, to the staff to the amenities made our stay at the Park Hyatt Istanbul near perfect. The location, in a high end neighborhood, was perfect as shopping and great restaurants were in walking distance. The spa king accommodations are amazing with the most impressive bathrooms I have seen in any hotel. I want a private Haman in my house now. Everyone we encountered was friendly helpful and very professional. The hotel is smaller about 70 rooms I believe, so it has a very nice feel with a real personalized stay. The Concierge Helen, provided great advice, and we found the wait staff in the restaurant offering warm and gracious service and all the food we had was outstanding. Their breakfast buffet is impressive and we enjoyed how they offered many Turkish breakfast specialties along with the many continental items. The spa staff was very professional and provided wonderful treatments. This truly is a very well run property.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional, Classic with a hi-tec makeover”
Reviews.Author: Alexander028
Reviews.Content: Lobby is like a James Bond set, then you wonder why the receptionist insists on showing you how your room works - do not turn this down if offered because the room lighting system is not just a matter of On and Off. They provide a Euro/UK electric socket adapter. Thick walls and you can't hear a thing. I wish they had a toaster at breakfast; but the offering is lavish and you can order cooked food as well as the buffet. Staff are charming and polite. No plug in bathroom sink, although there is one in the drinking water sink beside it. Surrounded by the same high-class shops you see in London and New York - there's even an M&S next to a Topshop and a Starbucks. Not much else to see or do within walking distance. Safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely cool -- too cool?”
Reviews.Author: Ana-Maria Z
Reviews.Content: Super-modern hotel with all the modcons (took 1/2 hour to figure out the lights). Excellent concierge service and large rooms, especially the spa ones. However, note that there is some street noise and that it is located near the trendy, expensive shops -- so if you live near New York or other large metro city, and are touristing, this may not be the experience you seek. Ancillaries (such as internet) very expensive. Best part? the super restaurant right in front.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fhpete
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business for a week in October. This is called a boutique hotel, but the room I had was large and comfortable. Street noise was a bit of an issue but not on a consistent basis at night. The area of the hotel is very nice, with great restaurants and high end shopping in walking distance - almost every direction. Food was terrific and the staff can't be beat. The concierge desk is strategically placed and constantly staffed with engaged and talented professionals. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “expensive but good”
Reviews.Author: emjaytx
Reviews.Content: always tip top on service but you do pay, even if you use points they do get you on everything else , but i suppose for this establishment it is expected . 1 concierge was outstanding and gave us a lot of help and tips. we were upgraded to a very large room that was beautiful i have to admit i have never been disappointed with park Hyatt service

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in historical building...Top quality”
Reviews.Author: martin120
Reviews.Content: Top quality modern hotel in historical building in residential area of istanbul with many restaurants walking distance. the hotel restaurant is perfect too the spa is great and the service quality is tops

Reviews.Title: “Chic location and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: chubbs1London
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at the Park Hyatt in late September for 3 nights and had a very pleasant stay The location of the hotel is lovely, surrounded by designer stores and great little cafe's and restaurants. It is not a million miles from the metro station and none of the cabs we took to travel around took that long or cost a fortune. The rooms were comfortable and well planned, we had a juliet balcony overlooking the pool area which was pretty. The one thing which was slightly irritating was that when we arrived we decided to grab something to eat before we ventured out and the menu in the hotel room which had a wide variety of dishes was not available anywhere BUT in the room or so we were told by the waitress by the pool. The menu which was available was limited but the food which we had was delicious. Breakfast which is served just off the lobby was fab with lot's of selection and not as expensive as some of the the other Hyatt breakfasts we have had. All in all a great stay and we recommended it to my parents who went last week and also enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Culluk
Reviews.Content: I'm Turkish but live abroad and travel a decent amount. Stayed at the Park Hyatt for 5 days back in September and was very impressed. I've stayed at the Ciragan before and other hotels when I'm in town for business. I dont have anything negative to say about the Park Hyatt. Location is in Nisantasi which is quite central and a cool area. Its sort of in the middle of the old town (sultanahmet) and the hot spots in Ortakoy/Bebek, etc. The service is excellent, the rooms are very nice (my room had a hamam in it and a steam room), the breakfast is superb (cooked breakfast included in the price and you can even have it in your room). The pool is small (Ciragan's pool is of course amazing) but still good for a dip. The gym is small but has the necessary equipment. Nisantasi of course has shopping, cafes, cinema's etc so there's things to do around as well. The service level, as mentioned, is very high and personal. Same time I stayed there I had several friends from London at the hotel as well, they all loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sardinnia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a short city break- and found it very impressive. Staff is very professional and provide attentive service. Location: in a very interesting area of Istanbul- close to some good shopping opportunities. Would recommend this hotel to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Oasis”
Reviews.Author: atw100
Reviews.Content: My family booked three rooms at the hotel, all of which had been reserved as standard rooms. We were given two suites (which seem to be "standard") that were absolutely lovely (but without views) and one oversized room with an excellent view. The suites had a comfortable sitting area that could be closed off with pocket doors from the spacious bedroom. The bathrooms were large and luxurious with a tiled stall shower, separate WC cubicle, a second sink with filtered water and a large tub. The room had excellent bedding, 2 televisions, a Nespresso coffee maker and charming amenities. The hotel has an excellent pool and good but very expensive food. It is located in the most upscale area of Istanbul with Chanel, Hermes and many good restaurants and cafes nearby. There is a lot of lively street life and a real neighborhood feeling. I've stayed at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet many times before, and the Park Hyatt is much nicer in every respect except that the Four Seasons is a lot more convenient for Old City sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: RishT
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a couple in October this year. Its in the Nisantasi area which is a great location to be at if you are young and you like great cafes, bars and small clubs. It has an energetic buzz in the evening and its in the hip and happening part of Istanbul. There are many shops in the area also almost all the brands are present international as well as local. The rooms are also great, well planned, modern and amenities are superb. We also had a steam in the room which is very relaxing. The service is fabulous all the staff are extremely courteous and helpful. Special mention for the entire concierge team they really go out of the way to help you and have good knowledge about the city. If you are looking for a large luxurious spa then this is not the hotel for you, it has a small spa with a very good therapist and there is no Turkish Haman in the Spa. This hotel is all about location, service and very comfortable modern rooms with great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTLHD
Reviews.Content: Great Location. The hotel is modern, new and clean. Staff speaks English. However the Breakfast is average.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, but not as good as the Park Hyatt Tokyo”
Reviews.Author: marais75012
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Park Hyatt before moving to the Ramada where I had to attend a conference (my company would not pay for a Park Hyatt room). This was my second stay at a Park Hyatt property, and as such I had high expectations - which were mostly fulfilled, but the experience was not as remarkable as the Tokyo Park Hyatt. I think I have to try a few more to see if the Tokyo hotel is really the expection. I found it impressive how they kept the typical Park Hyatt cold and sober elegance and yet managed to give it the turkish touch. The interior designer clearly did an excellent job. Of course it broke my heart when I had to leave and move to the Ramada. There's two things I found a bit - problematic. The location is far from the tram or subway, and you either walk (across a park) or take a cab. Other hotels in the same area are closer to public transportation. I did not really mind, but expected some kind of shuttle service like in Tokyo. And then there's the internet fee, totally inappropriate. I think I will give the Hyatt Regency a try next time in Istanbul. The location is closer to Taxim, and the pool is larger.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Park Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: DRMBinDC
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel was a treat. Beautiful room - we were upgraded to a room with a hammam. Very modern spin on a Turkish tradition. The pool area was small, but stylish. The outdoor restaurant by the pool was lovely. Breakfast menu served great options. Concierge was very helpful. Hotel is located in a quiet/upscale area. Easy walk to train to old part of city, and a quick taxi ride to Taksim Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Service - Location”
Reviews.Author: Lawthomas
Reviews.Content: The 100 year old building has been converted to a 90 room hotel in the best shopping district (Macka) in Istanbul. The hotel is convenient to everything. The steakhouse, Prime, is very good. The breakfast, served in the lobby, is imaginative at a reasonable price. Our Terrace Suite was fantastic, with a Turkish hamman bath and 49 foot terrace over looking the outdoor dining area and pool. The hotel was built as an apartment house for the former Italian Embassy located across the road.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: Martha B
Reviews.Content: We have been in many luxury hotels around the world and this hotel, its facitilties, its staff and most particularly its management are beyond excellence. The hotel is meticulously clean, the rooms are large and very comfortable and the food outstanding. The hotel staff are the most professionally mannered individuals with a genuine warm-hearted disposition to assit you with any request. They reflect the exemplary leadership of the general manager. Not only is this hotel superbly run, but also is situated in the upscale and safe Macka Park area. It is a 5 star hotel with a 4 star rating... It is the best location in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vickyscriv
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful modern hotel with a Turkish twist. I stayed in a suite which was amazing, huge room, living area and the bathroom had a steam/shower and large bathtub with mood lighting. It is located in a nice area, lots of high end shops and restaurants around within walking distance. The hotel has a nice poolside restaurant though the menu is a bit limited the food was great. Very nice staff and surroundings - would definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great neighborhood, bad service”
Reviews.Author: Alef1
Reviews.Content: Positive points: large and well decorated suites in the last floor, good views, good places to walk around in a trendy section. Negative points: slow and kafkian service, spa always empty with noone avalilable.

Reviews.Title: “My absolute favorite”
Reviews.Author: ahmadsameh
Reviews.Content: Simply the best, no hotel room anywhere is any better than this, staff gracious and extremely polite, cosy atmosphere, sophisticated but not pretentious, located in my favourite area in my favourite city. Park Hyatt are at the top of my list and my first choice anywhere, and this is definitely the best Park Hyatt i have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamClaudia3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the nice up market Nisantasi area, quite far from the old town but therefor maybe as well pleasant. The staff is very service minded, capable and friendly without beinig humble which I really appreciate! In short: the all over atmosphere in the hotel is most pleasurable. The rooms are large, bathroom very nice and comfortable and all the conveneinces you wish for in a hotel room are there. Moreover and especially this time of the year, we really enjoyed spending some time at the lovely pool area after a day of exploring this beautiful city. Overall, if you're considering a place away from the traditional tourist areas, I 'd highly recommend this Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great destination!”
Reviews.Author: cruff7117
Reviews.Content: Wonderful sightseeing and shopping. Hotels very good. Beware of taxi drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not again”
Reviews.Author: Travelerworldbelgium
Reviews.Content: Positive: - New(er) hotel - Large rooms - Nice bathrooms - Friendly staff - Good concierge Negative: - NOISY ROOM (on street side as well as pool side), woken up several times during the night because of street noise - Far from old city - Taxi drivers do not know the hotel (or pretend) - 18 Eur a day for wireless - Already dirty stains on carpet and chairs in room - Low pressure shower - Most rooms have NO view whatsoever - Breakfast buffet has fresh things on it but not kept cold enough(risky...) - Medium level food quality in restaurant,do not expect typical turkish dishes - Reception staff only so, so - Small pool with no privacy (from bar) To conclude I would not recommend but would try to go for hotel with Bosporus view instead.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel... truly like a palace”
Reviews.Author: DrewFromHonolulu
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Istanbul or at a Park Hyatt, but I hope to come back. The building itself is a historic facility that has been nicely updated with modern conveniences. The remodeling was equally classy and comfortable. My room included prints by Turkish (ex Magnum) photographer Ara GÃ¼ler (you can visit his cafe just off Istikial Caddesi). It was a perfect transformation to an Istanbul of today or the early days of the Republic. The neighborhood is very nice too. On a night walk I happened to see the Pamuk Apartments that is described in the Nobel Prize-winner's memoir. This is only a few blocks from the hotel. The view outside is of a lovely building that used to be the Italian Embassy. Each hotel room has wonderful amenities -- a sink with filtered water, an amazing bath, huge flat screen TV with many international stations, wifi, and even a cute "low tech kit" with pencil and eraser. The room was just so perfect that it was almost tempting to simply stay in the room and make it a real holiday, but Istanbul was awaiting. The best part is the staff. I normally don't like being called by name, but somehow the staff made it seem genuine. The concierge is a member of les Clefs d'Or and like many staff members is multilingual, friendly, knowledgeable, and pleasant. The room was spotless. The front desk, bell staff, and management were all wonderful. I imagine the food was fantastic, but I was out exploring the city and missed eating in. This is the kind of hotel that I've always dreamed of, but never experienced. I know this sounds a bit over the top, but it really is a perfect place to stay. I hope they don't change a thing.

Reviews.Title: “nice room but no view”
Reviews.Author: LondonFamilia
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights the plus:Room fantastic spacious and bed so comfortable Service particularly from the concierge is absolutely great in general the service was always good except we had one guy at the reception that was arrogant the negative: Location is in a nice up market area but if its your first time in Istanbul its far remote from the old city and some of the nice restaurants on the Bosphorus the view is terrible we were on the signature level and the view is the back of a ugly building and i ask if the only view we could have ..yes except some suites only on the 8 level have partial view also a big problem was that we asked for a nonsmoking room and we ended up with a room that smells so badly the smoke we had to change the following morning for ...another smoking room that they put some steam cleaners and perfume that resulted in a worst smell and when i told the guy at reception the only answer was he could not do more a bit of unexpected service for a Park Hyatt hotel

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: Chukcha_reader
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great in all respects: location (close to Istanbul's hip hang-out area), design, quality and service. You feel welcomed there - the staff makes serious efforts to make sure your stay is as pleasant and comfortable as possible. And what's important, it doesn't come out as superficial, it feels very genuine. The attention to detail is truly amazing. You see it in everything from the overall room design to the little things like complimentary fruits and sweets, nice toiletries, linen laundry bags instead of traditional plastic ones. I had a single room and it was huge with a large bed, full-size desk and a separate hygene area (toilet, sink, shower, bathtub). Everything is designed in a beautiful modern style with top-quality furnishings and fixtures. I haven't tried hotel's restaurant but breakfast was excellent. In the summer, they will have a roof-top terrace with a bar and a lounge area - very hip and cool. Overall, if you're considering a place away from the traditional tourist areas, I 'd highly recommend this Park Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTealady
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely stunning - one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The rooms were a perfect mixture of antique charm and modern style, and were absolutely huge. I just loved every bit of staying here. The breakfasts were so delicious and the staff were so professional, friendly and efficient. The charming concierge was adorable and gave us the best tips and recommendations - his help really made our trip a successful. I couldn't praise this place more highly. If you have the opportunity, go!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of cool Istanbul, a boutique hotel that is human too ...”
Reviews.Author: Geniusworks
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Cool, stylish with great friendly service. Fantastic location in heart of Nisantasi, the city's boho quarter. Rooms excellent with great music players to chill out, bathrooms to relax, and bar for quiet meetings. Beautiful decor ever step of the way. Fabulous breakfasts. And just really nice people with natural friendly service. Wifi is still expensive, especially if you have multi devices, but nothing is quite perfect (yet)!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful ServiceI”
Reviews.Author: mangoriver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with two of our friends in two separate king spa rooms for three days. The room is every bit as magnificent as they sound -- we used the sauna every day (sometimes even twice a day), and it was especially relaxing after long-day romps around the city. One of the best things about the hotel is the breakfast! The buffet was a smorgasbord of offerings that included fresh and dried fruits, cold cuts, olives, fresh-baked pastries, cheeses, honeys, and yogurts. On top of that, we were offered a hot entree that ranged from pancakes to tasty omelets. Even if you don't have breakfast here, stop in for the great coffee - probably one of the best cups of coffee we've had anywhere. Another great thing about the hotel is Ali who worked the front desk. He's very knowledge and well-traveled, yet very down to earth and approachable. He gave us a tour of our room upon arrival, occasionally checked in on us, and spent an hour telling us about all the different parts of Turkey before we headed off. Ali was great and made our stay stand-out! (Also, the concierge was most helpful and patient, but I can't remember her name.) The downside is that the Park Hyatt is fairly far from the main sites. We walked once from the Blue Mosque back, and being fit, late 20-something folks, it was still quite a trek. The upside is that you'll get to see a different part of town. The immediate area is pretty swanky with lots of international retail and little restaurants (some of which are terrible tourist traps.) The best restaurant we ate at while in Turkey was Kosebasi, which is directly across the street from the hotel. It's a local chain, but the food was just out of this world and the atmosphere was jovial and light. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average experience”
Reviews.Author: virgilandelsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Witt Suites and then moved to Park Hyatt to experience another area of Istanbul. This hotel was about 3 times more expensive than the Witt and not nearly so lovely or comfortable. I booked a room with a special Turkish bath, which turned out to be an in room sauna (not really very useful or pleasant) with a standard bath and small marble basin and foot stool with a remote control for ?light therapy which was different colored light emanating from one light. Ridiculously expensive breakfast. The bed was very comfortable and the room was large. The view from the room was over a fairly run down apartment building and it's carpark and a small pool and closed terrace area which had not been cleaned in some time. The staff were pleasant. The gym was good. The room service was average. Wifi was also very expensive and sporadic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms but overpriced food.”
Reviews.Author: Bedouins
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in a spa king room. The room was excellent particularly having the steam room and Hannah available. Service was equally excellent. However the cost of food and the quality of the meals we had, left a lot to be desired, which was mirrored across the whole city. We ate in Prime and found the steaks contained large amounts of gristle and the mashed potato resembled custard as it was so runny. Not to much to complain about really but the bill with one bottle of cheaper Turkish wine, two average starters and two steaks came to Â£170! The same was encountered at Mikla although the food was better there for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer luxury! Fantastic attention to detail especially in their bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: mlelsc
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and excellently renovated. Lobby is a bit disappointing though and lacks atmosphere. Service throughout the hotel is very good. Bedrooms are fantastic...superbly fitted out and so comfortable. Bathrooms are exceptionally well fitted. Food was excellent and good variety of dishes served in the restaurants. The area in which the hotel is located is upmarket so expect prices to be fairly high but a short trip by taxi to the big shopping district is only about 12 minutes away. Nice park situated just a few hundred metres from the hotel which has a good playground for children. Istanbul overall is a beautiful city and has so much culture and history to offer. It is a city well worth visiting. Huge selection of restaurants in Istanbul also and local produce as in fruits etc are top quality.. Make sure to visit the Galeta Tower as well as the underground Roman Water Basicila....Topaki Palace is a must too. There is a wonderful cemetery overlooking the city & has splendid views of the course of the Bosphorous River. Piet Loti (famous french author) resided in this area and there is a beautiful little house where his works are on show. Well worth a visit and not on the tourist trail or in guidebooks! Night life thrives in this city and the many tiny cobbled side streets are a must to see. Public transport overall in the city is good but beware of the traffic! In daytime hours it is horrendous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good with minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: areviewer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cool - great decor - with amazing rooms - however, it is fairly pricey. The service is very good - and the spa treatments were amazing. The area is extremely up market with top end shops on the street next to the hotel - it is a bit like Sloane Street in London. My gripes are: The outside area looks a bit tired - the pool looks great in the pictures - but is surrounded by offices + flats - all looking at the pool area. The pool was freezing and a bit worn. I would defintely go back though

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of peace and beauty”
Reviews.Author: Galubushka
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean and functional suite, beautifully fitted. Bathroom floor is heated. Helpful staff. A wonderful hotel in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have stayed in in Istanbul ($ for $)”
Reviews.Author: AlbertR
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed for 3 nights in this hotel over an extended weekend, while in Istanbul for the World Basketball Championships and the U2 Concert there. We arrived at around 11am on Saturday morning, and, as requested, we were quickly checked in immediately (no issue with our early arrival), by the very friendly staff. The Hotel is located in one of the best areas of Istanbul, Nisantasi, which is the prime shopping area. The location is excellent. The Hotel opened in 2008, and is in pristine condition. The room (a Spa King room) was HUGE! Very clean, with an amazing spa bathroom (with hamam / steam bath, rain shower and a huge bathtub), all lights electronically controlled, super sized very comfortable bed, large LCD TV with DVD player, large closet, overall a great room, in great condition. Service was always fast and efficient, and delivered with a smile and a greeting. I used the Hotel Spa for a Thai Massage which was excellent, and very well priced. Overall, and I don't say this too often, a great hotel, very well managed! I have stayed in other Hotels in Istanbul, including the Hyatt, but this one beats them all if we consider the price paid for each one. We paid â‚¬440 / night (without breakfast), and I can tell you that I felt that the price was fair compared to the Four Seasons or the Ciragan at double that.

Reviews.Title: “First Class in Chic Area”
Reviews.Author: a_b75W_denswil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is top notch in respect of service and facilities in the room. The food in the lobby is fantastic. The hotel is squeezed in between nightclubs and a busy street in addition to being quite remote from all sights. It hence is noisy. The spa package including a turkish bath in your room is quite an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Toret8
Reviews.Content: It's a small boutique hotel, not as the Park Hyatt you can find in Beijing, Shanghai or Moscow, but still with the excellent quality that characterizes them. The service I received was simply amazing. Friendly and efficient staff. I had a problem with the water flow in my room and without even asking they offered me an upgraded room. The restaurant is also excellent and the location is great and in a very safe area. The only negative point is the spa (just an extremelly small sauna) and the fitness, too small and limited machines to do an appropriate workout. I would still come back next time I travel to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ShilpaLakhani
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like a breath of fresh air when we walked in first! The lobby is tastefully done with some interesting coffee table books. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. I loved the bathroom the most since they had a tub and a separate shower with steam! The pool is really different, but the water was too cold even for a summer morning! The gym is functional with the right machinery to ensure we stay fit after all teh delicious Turkish food! Park Hyatt, even though new and far from public transport, is absolutely lovable!The staff is very friendly and the entire mood is set to spoil you! Exactly what we need on a vacation!! The highlight being the beverage card where one can choose their beverage and time they'd like to have it, I could actually get bed tea at a desired time.

Reviews.Title: “Park Hyatt was a dream hotel”
Reviews.Author: alycat10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Park Hyatt for 5 nights in mid-July. From the moment our cab arrived, we knew it would be a 5-star experience. The staff were extremely welcoming and we felt very safe with the 24-hr security guards. We had a Park Deluxe King room which included the most amazing bathroom - heated floors! It also had a seperate shower and soaking tub and a fresh water sink for drinking. The breakfast (which was included in our room rate) was to die for! Pastries, yogurts, fruits and plenty more. Try to get it included in your room as it is a bit pricey otherwise. Park Hyatt is in a GREAT neighborhood if you like shopping & cafes. It is a mix between Madison Avenue and Soho in NYC with shops like Gucci, Armani and lovely cafes and restaurants. I can't imagine a better area to be in - also we were very close to all the big sights (cab ride). Also, the Park Hyatt's restaurant, Prime, was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ibbythegreat
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in. We stayed in a park king deluxe which had a bosphoros view and a large bathroom. The service and overall style and quality of the hotel is exceptional. I would strongly reccomend a stay in here over the W istanbul which we also stayed in which we were very dissapointed with. The hotel is close to shops in the nistani area where you can find a range of shops from high end to high street. We were very impressed with the hotel and look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Not many better than this.”
Reviews.Author: Beachbilly
Reviews.Content: If you are willing to pay for luxury, Park Hyatt Istanbul is good value. Relatively new, the rooms are in great shape -- great style and comfort (AC works great and the bathroom floors are heated).Some rooms have spectacular views of the Bosphorus. The security/bell staff at the front entrance are great - they are a great source in addition to the concierge. Once you are done with the big sites (and that only takes one day), this is a great part of town for everything else. (For example, short taxi ride to the launch point for the 2 hour boat ride on the Bosphorus - if you haven't been on the Bosphorus, it is a must.)

Reviews.Title: “Spa room is unique - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AroundTheWorld2828
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic place in a great city. As a Hyatt Diamond member on an award stay, we got upgraded to one of their spa rooms. This room has a mini-spa instead of a regular bathroom, with hamam/steam bath. Heated floors in the bathroom, bosporus view. Breakfast is great. The neighborhood is safe and good to walk in, and the attractions of the city are not too far away. Good breakfast. Small but nice pool. Since Hyatt does not have any beach hotels in Europe, if you want to get some sun, this is a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: doudacairo
Reviews.Content: room standard .. very high quality had a spa room one of the best among the Parks i have been in. location little bit out of Istanbul attractions but taxis is very easy just less than 10 minutes you can go anywhere and always available. the area full of boutiques, restaurant and coffe shops staff are very attentive which somthing that you always expect from the Park Hyatt did not tray the food at the hotel. concierge gave great syggestions regarding eating outside one restaurant you have to tray is sunset amazing location on top of the hill with wonderful food + service the hotel entrance is discrete but this the park hyatt usually like that

Reviews.Title: “cold swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail56
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, BUT water in the outdoor pool is not heated , so it is useless in May

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely one of the best hotels I have been to...”
Reviews.Author: Ticoco79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 months as I was working in Istanul. On my second / third day there, it already felt like home. The attention to detail is amazing and the staff friendliness, care and efficiency is brillant. The hotel is medium sized and very subtle so if you are looking for a hotel like an airport, dont go there but if you are looking for charm, elegance and service, this is definitely the hotel to be at. The old town is around 25-30 mins taxi ride away however and in traffic can take longer but if you are there on holiday then, just avoid the peak hour. The Nisantisi area is fantastic .. with great restaurants etc. The concierge will pretty much give you a plan if you are there for a couple of days of what to do and where to go eat...High reccommend the hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LeleItaly
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect in every way. Rooms (also basic ones) are really spacious, very well refined and the bathroom is just perfect, especially the tub with colour teraphy. A must in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: adorable79
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights in a suite, everything was perfect during our stay. special highlights of the room the heated bathroom floor and the extra sink with fresh water.

Reviews.Title: “At Home at the Park Hyatt Macka Palas”
Reviews.Author: macsym
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully understated entrance conceals a warmth of hospitality that is quite remarkable! Never have I felt so much at home in an hotel so quickly. Despite our early 8am arrival we were warmly greeted by name and with the minimum of formalities escorted to our beautifully appointed spa room by the charming receptionist Doruk. Spa rooms are spacious, beautifully appointed, have ample storage, versatile lighting, beautiful linens and come with all modern day expectations. Those on the 6th floor (as opposed to the 7th) have the advantage of Romeo and Juliette balconies which give even better views of the Bosphorus. Of course their piece de resistance is the bathroom â€“ probably the size of a large bedroom in Sultanamet, they offer a separate WC, wash basin area (with a dedicated drinking water basin) and huge â€˜wet roomâ€™ which contains a large bath, steam room and haman facility complete with pestemals (fringed towels) tas (metal bowl) and kese (scrubbing cloth) together with some wonderfully aromatic Isparta rose soap and â€˜moodâ€™ lighting â€“ in addition to a television screen! Bathroom toiletries are from Blaise Mautin in an intoxicating perfume made especially for this Park Hyatt and which pervades the whole hotel. Public areas include a spacious lobby area which incorporates a lounge serving delicious breakfasts (and all day dining) in addition to a delightful bar area featuring a good selection of wines. There is also a separate formal restaurant (Prime) and open-air terrace with outdoor pool, small spa and 24 hour gym. However, surpassing all this luxuriousness, are the staff who really make this â€˜homeâ€™ somewhere special. From the suave and knowledgeable Guest Services Manager, Anthony and the ever present Front Office Manager, Kevin to breakfast supervisor Caner and bar attendant Merve, the various concierges, door staff and others, guests are treated with warmth and individuality, often and frequently being addressed by name â€“ this is hotelkeeping of the highest order and those who appreciate such attributes will surely enjoy this hotel. Personally, even as a first time visitor to Istanbul, I loved the location, surrounded by stylish shops, cafes and restaurants, yet within an easy downhill stroll to Kabatas and the tramway which will take one to Sultanamet; or a ride on the teleferic cable car and onward to Taksim. I long to return!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Gunner7
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at the Park Hyatt in both Tokyo & Seoul, we were expecting great things of the Macka Palace and we weren't disappointed. The hotel was wonderful. It's in an old 1920's building which has been beautifully restored and the understated location in a small side street is fantastic although be aware that most taxi drivers go to the other Hyatt so make sure you have a small map with you! Some reviews have commented on the hotel being 15-20 minutes from the main sights but it's actually much nicer not to stay in the tourist area. Not only were there loads of shops - everything from Gucci to M&S - but there were tons of amazing restaurants and cafe's within a 5 minute walk. We were upgraded to one of the larger rooms on the 6th floor with a partial view of the Bosphorous. The room was extremely comfortable with a huge bed, large flat screen tv and fresh fruit which was replenished every day. There was also an enormous bathroom with it's own tv, steam room, separate basin with drinking water, heated floor and coloured mood lighting. All the staff at the hotel, without exception, were genuinely wonderful. They were helpful and friendly and nothing was ever too much trouble. I would say that the internet cost â‚¬18/day and that drinks were very expensive but that seems to be par for the course in Istanbul generally. You'd be hard pressd to find a hotel this good anywhere else in Istanbul and I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel! But watch out for music”
Reviews.Author: DisneyT
Reviews.Content: The Park Hyatt Istanbul was quite possibly the most amazing hotel I have stayed at...design and service wise. The hotel is fairly small and located in the most posh neighborhood of Istanbul with tons of high end shops. I had a spa King room. It was such an amazing room I didn't leave it for a whole day! Just relaxed, took long showers, enjoyed the private steam room that was in the bathroom. The service was impeccable as always with Park Hyatt. Upon check in I was escorted all the way up to my room, introduced to the features of the room, etc. They have DVD's available for rent at the Concierge desk that was nice to have. My one complaint. You go to a hotel to sleep...but unfortunately (and no fault of the hotel), there is a night club that had music pumping very loudly until about 3 a.m. This was a Saturday night. I pretty much was unable to sleep that night. If you ask to be put on the street side you probably won't have this problem, or if you are there during the weekdays. The fitness center was well equipped but did not have any free weights or barbells, which surprised me.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lkchgo
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul last September and spent 10 days at the Park Hyatt Mackas. We cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Fabulous staff, location, room and breakfast! We were supposed to split our stay between the Park Hyatt and the Ciragan Kempinsky and cancelled the Kempinsky! The Kempinsky had nice grounds and a bonus on the Bospherous but we just couldn't leave the atmosphere and service at the Park Hyatt! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: profroth
Reviews.Content: Pamper yourself with a hotel room whose bathroom floors are heated! Great, friendly staff. Great location, if the cabbies can find it Beautiful neighborhood, beautiful rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: RGTLondon
Reviews.Content: I took my family to this hotel, and while it has many of the features I would expect from a Park Hyatt - excellent staff, great food, attentive service, I would counsel that there are better options in the city. A few points on the hotel - the pool was not heated during our stay and was freezing. Just not good enough. Our suite had no view - none whatoever. Very few people in the city know where the hotel is (as it is new) and as such, you cant get in a cab and be sure of making it back there easily. In contrast we went to the Four Seasons - a hotel in a different league.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful luxury hotel with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: DucksOnParade
Reviews.Content: This was literally one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. The standard room was beautiful and quite large. The bathroom was amazing--steam shower, heated floors, large bathtub, a separate basin sink with drinking water, etc, etc. We really appreciated all the extras in the room--bathrobes, slippers, a large bowl of fresh fruit on arrival, free DVDs, great bath products. Service was excellent--as you'd expect from Park Hyatt. The only thing that could have made this hotel even better would have been a nicer view. Also, the wireless internet connection in the room was not all that reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection!”
Reviews.Author: mauiguys
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel in a fascinating city! Everything about the hotel is perfect. The staff is top notch, the rooms are gorgeous, and the location is in a very chic neighborhood. The only negative as others have said, is that no Taxi drivers seem to know where the hotel is, but we were prepared and carried the map we got from the concierge to show the taxi drivers the exact location. Do yourself a favor and stay at this hotel, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about the location ...”
Reviews.Author: Chick1961
Reviews.Content: Fantastic rooms and very reasonable rates! Let down by the lack of a view. We had a room overlooking the pool which is surrounded by offices and residential blocks. The staff were great but be wary of the prices for drinks etc Taxi drivers seemed unaware of the existence of the hotel so guessing it's fairly new as the tend to take you to the Regency Hyatt Wouldn't hesitate in using this hotel again - very very nice

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sivally
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at, and I travel a lot. Very stylish, and the service was impeccable. The staff were knowledgable, friendly, and courteous. I've read other posts about other hotels and why being within walking distance of historical sights/mosques is so desirable. However, I'd rather be in the Nisantasi neighborhood where the Park Hyatt is and take a 20 minute cab rather than stay in the run down parts of the city just so I can walk to the tourist spots. The hotel is surrounded by very trendy shops, cool cafes, and excellent restaurants. Would not stay anywhere else during my next visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hyatt Istanbul - Macka Palas
HotelInfo.Address: Tesvikiye Bronz Sokak No. 4 | Macka Palas, Istanbul 34367, Turkey
